subject: p10439781
raw_hist: -year-old woman post-op after an orthopedic procedure is dyspneic.
raw_impr: PA and lateral chest compared to : Heterogeneous pulmonary opacification has worsened in both lungs. This is largely pulmonary edema, but more focal abnormalities in the axillary portion of the left lung and at the right lung base could be concurrent pneumonia. In addition, chest radiographs from suggest concurrent substantial interstitial lung disease. Mild-to-moderate cardiomegaly is stable. Endotracheal tube is no less than 2 cm from the carina, with the chin in neutral position. Care must be taken that it not advance inadvertently. A left subclavian infusion port ends in the right atrium. Dr. Was paged at the time of dictation.
